articles.title: Greetings to ANC of South Africa
articles.content:
Greetings to ANC of South Africa
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Thursday sent a congratulatory message to the National Executive Committee of the African National Congress (ANC) of South Africa on the occasion of the 104th anniversary of its foundation.
					 The message sincerely wished the ANC of South Africa greater success in its work for strengthening the party and achieving the prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties will grow stronger.

articles.title: S. Korea's Humiliating "Agreement" with Japan Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korea's Humiliating "Agreement" with Japan Denounced
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korean Committee on Measures for the Sexual Slavery for Japanese Army and Drafting Victims in a statement Thursday branded the "negotiations on comfort women" which south Korea claimed to have settled with Japan later last year as unprecedented humiliating negotiations which offered everything to Japan.
					 There can never be a final solution to the hideous crime related to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, crime unprecedented in history, without Japan's state acknowledgement of responsibility from legal point of view and its apology and reparation, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities staged the farce of nullifying the thrice-cursed crime committed by Japan. This is an intolerable insult to not only all the victims of the sexual slavery in the north and the south but to the Korean nation and the international community demanding Japan's responsibility and apology, and a wanton violation of human conscience and justice.
					
					 What is all the more infuriating is that the humiliating "agreement" was cooked up at the back-stage manipulation of the U.S. to put forward Japan, which inflicted huge calamities and sacrifice upon the Korean nation and other Asian people, as a shock brigade and hold a hegemonic position in the region.
					
					 The recent "agreement" which crafty Japan cooked up by coaxing the south Korean ruling quarters kowtowing to the U.S. with a few pennies of money is null and void and it can never be accepted by anyone.
					
					 All facts clearly prove that the south Korean authorities are a group of traitors who would not hesitate acts worse than the "agreement on the comfort women" in a bid to serve their American and Japanese masters.
					
					 The south Korean authorities have to clearly understand that their sycophantic act of treachery going against the mindset of the people will only bring a shameful ruin.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tajik Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tajik Political Party Leader
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, on December 29 last year.
					 The message said that the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan extended heartfelt greetings to Kim Jong Un and all the fraternal Korean people on the New Year on behalf of the communists of Tajikistan.
					
					 It expressed belief that the Korean people would register shining successes in the building of a thriving socialist nation under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un in the new year, too.
					
					 It wished him good health and happiness and great successes in carrying forward the cause and immortal ideas of the great leaders of the Korean people.

articles.title: Korean Women Vow to Display Heroic Stamina in This Year's Drive
articles.content:
Korean Women Vow to Display Heroic Stamina in This Year's Drive
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea met at the plaza of the Monument to Party Founding Thursday to vow to carry through the tasks set forth by Marshal Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address.
					 The reporter and speakers said upon hearing the exciting news that Juche Korea achieved a signal success in its first H-bomb test after receiving the New Year Address, all the officials and members of the union are filled with high national pride and conviction in sure victory.
					
					 They renewed their pledge to fulfill their responsibilities and duties in the general offensive for ushering in a great heyday in building a thriving nation by giving fullest play to the ardent loyalty to the party and extraordinary patriotic zeal in hearty response to the New Year Address.
					
					 They called for fully displaying the heroic stamina of the Korean women in the Songun era in the on-going drive for ushering in a golden age in building a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un and thus making a positive contribution to glorifying the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea as the one of victory and glory.

articles.title: Mass Rallies Held across Country
articles.content:
Mass Rallies Held across Country
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Mass rallies took place in South Phyongan, South Hamgyong, North Phyongan, Jagang, Kangwon, North Hamgyong and Ryanggang provinces and Rason City on Wednesday and Thursday to vow to carry out the tasks set forth by supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address. 
					 Present at the rallies were officials, working people and youths of party, power and economic bodies, working people's organizations, industrial establishments, farms and universities in local areas. 
					
					 Reporters and speakers said that the New Year Address made by Kim Jong Un serves as the militant banner arousing all the service personnel and people of the DPRK to the general charge for bringing about a new turn in all fields for building a thriving nation. 
					
					 They stressed the need for all the party members and other working people to channel all efforts into building an economic giant and bringing about a fresh turn in developing economy and improving people's living standard under the slogan "Let us usher in a golden age in building a thriving nation in this year when the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea is to be held!" 
					
					 At the end of the rallies the participants staged demonstrations.

articles.title: New Year Address Promising Fresh Progress
articles.content:
New Year Address Promising Fresh Progress
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The New Year address made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un encourages all leading economic officials and educators of the DPRK to be enthusiastic for devoting themselves to glorify this year as a golden age in building a thriving nation.
					 Kim Pong Yong, department director of the Ministry of Electric Power Industry, told KCNA that the New Year address makes economic officials of the country fully aware of their role.
					
					 The supreme leader in his New Year address called for dynamic advance of the electric-power, coal-mining and metallurgical industries and rail transport sector in the vanguard of the general offensive, he said, adding:
					
					 Bearing deep in minds his noble intention, we will increase electric-power output to the maximum by operating all power stations at full capacity and push ahead with a work to create more generating capacity. And we will stage a dynamic drive to make an effective use of natural energy and economize electricity.
					
					 Kim Il Nam, rector of the Tele-education College under Kim Chaek University of Technology, said:
					
					 My college produced first-term graduates last year and, on this basis, we will continue to improve the condition, environment and quality of education, thus turning out more competent graduates conducive to building a thriving nation.
					
					 Kang Yong Chol, minister of Fisheries, said:
					
					 I will do my best to put the fishing industry of the country on a higher level, as done by officials and fishermen in the fisheries run by the Korean People's Army who brought about the "spectacular scenery of a good catch of fish".
					
					 The ministry is planning to focus all its efforts on putting the fishing industry on a scientific basis, increase the number of days spent fishing at all fisheries and develop the offshore fish breeding and aquaculture in a big way this year.

articles.title: DPRK Citizens Intent on Study of New Year Address
articles.content:
DPRK Citizens Intent on Study of New Year Address
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The servicepersons and civilians in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea are now intent on the study of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's New Year address, which calls for ushering in a golden age in building a thriving nation this year when the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea is to be held.
					 Citizens of different social strata are seen avidly reading papers carrying the address in tram cars, buses and public places.
					
					 TV, radio and other media have frequently reported the full text of the New Year address or articles explaining it to help the people in their study.
					
					 Officials of the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions set it as their overriding work for the year to fully grasp the ideas and contents carried in the New Year address, conducting the study of it in various forms and ways.
					
					 Such scenes can be seen everywhere in the country, including industrial establishments and co-op farms.
					
					 Ri Jong Chol, department director of the State Science and Technology Commission, told KCNA:
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's New Year address serves as the banner inspiring all the people to a general advance for this year.
					
					 The commission will make a great progress in its guidance over the development of science and technology this year, so that the front of science can take the lead in a nationwide drive to usher in a golden age in building a thriving nation.

articles.title: DPRK People Hail Principle of Self-Development
articles.content:
DPRK People Hail Principle of Self-Development
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The successful first H-bomb test in the DPRK hardens its scientists' will to hold fast to the principle of giving priority to self-development on the front of science.
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un attended an inaugural ceremony of the newly-built Sci-Tech Complex at the outset of this year, opening the first gate to the significant new year with science.
					
					 Encouraged by his noble intention, all scientists of the country have turned out in a grand advance for the nation's development of science and technology.
					
					 They are unanimous in saying that the successful test showed again the DPRK's will to outpace the world by dint of science.
					
					 Pak Chol Nam, a researcher of the Branch Academy of Railway Science under the State Academy of Sciences, told KCNA:
					
					 Science and technology guarantees an economic power and it is the key to breaking through the cutting edge.
					
					 With a strong sense of self-reliance we will do our best to smoothly settle the problems arising in the serial production of Korean-style subway train and thus show the might of the scientists and technicians of Juche Korea.
					
					 Meanwhile, young people across the country are greatly encouraged by the news of the successful H-bomb test.
					
					 Rim Yong Gon, chairman of the Ryongsong District, Pyongyang, Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said:
					
					 The successful H-bomb test is a national-historic event that guarantees the eternal future of the country.
					
					 It made us youths feel deeply the enormous might of the principle of self-development.
					
					 We are now replete with a will to fully display our youthful energy and wisdom in the general offensive for building an economic power and a highly-civilized nation like the H-bomb developers.

articles.title: DPRK's Access to H-bomb Is Right to Self-Defense: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK's Access to H-bomb Is Right to Self-Defense: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's H-bomb test and access to it are an exercise of its legitimate right to self-defense and a just measure which allows no one to slander, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The DPRK's H-bomb test is not a breach of any international law.
					
					 The H-bomb test and access to it are the right to self-defence to be exercised to firmly defend the sovereignty of the country and the vital right of the nation from ever-growing nuclear threat and blackmail of the U.S.-led hostile forces and to reliably safeguard the peace on the Korean Peninsula and regional security.
					
					 No country has ever tried to save or sympathized with the DPRK exposed to the nuclear threat and blackmail of the U.S. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK have cherished the immutable truth that their destiny should be protected by their own efforts under the grave situation.
					
					 That was why the DPRK had access to H-bomb of justice. 
					
					 The more desperately the U.S. pursues its hostile policy toward the DPRK, the more thoroughly its army and people will implement the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts. It will exercise all its rights to self-defense undauntedly and legitimately in the future, too.

articles.title: Minju Joson Terms Conclusion of Peace Treaty Only Solution to Korean Issue
articles.content:
Minju Joson Terms Conclusion of Peace Treaty Only Solution to Korean Issue
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Of late foreign experts on Korean affairs expressed their freewheeling views on settling the issues of the Korean Peninsula. What merits attention is the fact that they share the view that the U.S. should respond to the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Thursday says that such fact goes to prove that whoever has reasonable thought about settling the issues of the Korean Peninsula sympathizes with the importance and urgency to conclude the peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The DPRK made the proposal for concluding the peace treaty to break a deadlock in dialogue for seeking solutions to the issues of the Korean Peninsula, ensure peace and stability and defuse the tension on the peninsula, clear the U.S. of security concern and usher in a favorable phase for the development of the political situation in the region and the rest of the world.
					
					 In fact, it was none other than the U.S. which compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons and created complexities and deliberate obstacles in the way of settling those matters.
					
					 The nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula would have found a solution long ago, had the U.S. rolled back its hostile policy towards the DPRK and opted for co-existing with it.
					
					 Regrettably, there has been no change in the attitude towards settling the Korean issue.
					
					 The U.S. actions to ratchet up sanctions and pressure on the DPRK only compelled it to intensify its counteraction against the former. As a result, the DPRK has grown stronger, far from being weak as expected by the former.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the U.S. persistent hostile policy towards the DPRK would put it in a more awkward position. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to opt for a right way for settling the Korean issue.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Authorities for Escalating Tension
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Authorities for Escalating Tension
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff of the south Korean army made an inspection of the area of Paekryong Island on January 1, shouting hoarse that "the north will perpetrate provocations against the south at unexpected time and place and in a rare way" and crying out for "taking thorough counteraction with perfect alert."
					 Meanwhile, the chief of Staff of the south Korean navy also cried out for "bolstering up combat capability to make a prompt and resolute retaliation against the enemy provocation."
					
					 Minju Joson on Thursday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The reckless confrontation remarks made by the south Korean warmongers and north-targeted war exercises staged in different parts of south Korea from the outset of the new year are deliberate provocations perpetrated by the confrontation maniacs to push the inter-Korean relations into a catastrophe.
					
					 It is fundamental to realizing Korea's reunification to defuse the danger of war and safeguard peace and security on the Korean Peninsula. That is why the DPRK has made patient efforts to achieve peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					 However, if aggressors and provocateurs choose to ignite a nuclear war against the north to chill the whole nation's desire for peaceful reunification, the powerful revolutionary Paektusan army will never pardon them but resolutely retaliate against them with a merciless sacred war of justice, a great war for national reunification.
					
					 The south Korean war maniacs should not misjudge the DPRK's patient efforts for peace on the peninsula and regional stability but stop going reckless.
					
					 If they truly want the improved north-south relations and peaceful reunification, they should halt the dangerous war exercises and military provocations escalating the tension.

articles.title: Foreign Intellectuals Demand Solution to Issue of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
articles.content:
Foreign Intellectuals Demand Solution to Issue of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- At least 380 intellectuals of south Korea and several countries decided to form an academic body for settling the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, according to the south Korean newspaper Hankook Ilbo.
					 The "Meeting for Promoting the Establishment of the Society for Study of Comfort Women for Imperial Japanese Army" said this on Jan. 4.
					
					 The organization said that intellectuals of south Korea and several countries, including professors and researchers, will organize the "Society for Study of Comfort Women for Imperial Japanese Army" for a correct solution to the issue of sexual slavery.
					
					 It noted that a seminar will bring the unlawfulness of the "agreement" made by south Korea and Japan recently on the issue of sexual slavery home to the public at home and abroad.

articles.title: S. Korean Bodies Demands Abrogation of Humiliating "Agreement"
articles.content:
S. Korean Bodies Demands Abrogation of Humiliating "Agreement"
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Organizations of south Korea held an emergency seminar in Seoul on Jan. 5 to reject the "agreement" reached between south Korea and Japan on the crimes related to sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, according to Thongil News, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 Speakers declared the "agreement" which excluded victims of sexual slavery null and void as it is violating all regulations of international law related to their rights.
					
					 They said that victims of sexual slavery should become the driving force for the solution to the issue of sexual slavery.
					
					 They demanded the authorities abrogate the "agreement".

articles.title: Korean in China Vows to Contribute to Movement for Independent Reunification
articles.content:
Korean in China Vows to Contribute to Movement for Independent Reunification
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, in a statement on Jan. 4 vowed to make positive contributions to the movement for independent reunification in hearty response to the historic New Year Address of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 He said that Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address clarified in a scientific and lucid manner the most fundamental and principled issues arising in the improvement of north-south relations and the movement for national reunification at present and clearly indicated the slogan, tasks and ways of the movement.
					
					 The issues of inter-Korean relations and national reunification should be settled by the concerted efforts of the Koreans in the idea of By Our Nation Itself and in conformity with the independent will and wishes of the nation, he said, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities must not seek pointless confrontation of systems, but show their will to respect and implement with sincerity the three principles for national reunification, June 15 Joint Declaration and October 4 Declaration, which crystallize the general will of the nation and whose validity has been proved in practice.
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China and all Koreans in China will take the lead in the patriotic movement for reunification in hearty response to the tasks for national reunification set forth by Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address and make positive contributions to the movement of all Koreans for independent reunification this year.

articles.title: Zhongnan Regional Association of General Association of Koreans in China Hails DPRK's Access to H-bomb
articles.content:
Zhongnan Regional Association of General Association of Koreans in China Hails DPRK's Access to H-bomb
 Beijing, January 6 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China Wednesday issued a statement hailing the success made by Juche Korea in its first H-bomb test. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The successful H-bomb test, pride of the Korean nation, marked a great event to be specially recorded in the national history spanning 5,000 years.
					
					 The DPRK's H-bomb test was a measure for self-defence taken to firmly protect the sovereignty of the country and the vital right of the nation from the ever-growing nuclear threat and blackmail by the U.S.-led hostile forces and to reliably safeguard the peace on the Korean Peninsula and regional security.
					
					 The successful test helped remarkably bolster up the DPRK's war deterrent and prevents any force from daring provoke our socialist country.
					
					 The DPRK is standing against the U.S., the chieftain of aggression watching for a change to ignite a war with huge nuclear weapons of various types. That is why, the DPRK's access to H-bomb of justice is an exercise of its legitimate right to self-defense as a sovereign state and a just measure which allows no one to slander.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Call for Ushering in New Era of Independent Reunification
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Call for Ushering in New Era of Independent Reunification
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Minjok Sibo, an overseas Koreans' newspaper published in Japan, on Jan. 1 carried New Year articles contributed by officials of overseas Koreans' organizations.
					 Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, said he was firmly convinced that the three principles of national reunification, the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it, are the programmes to be held fast to by all Koreans and they provide a guarantee for reunification.
					
					 Kwak Tong Ui, chairman of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, called for ushering in the second June 15 era of reunification in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 Rim Min Sik, chairman of the Overseas Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, said that the history of the people is sure to advance when Koreans are united through pan-national struggle, believes in justice and rely on the people's mindset, 
					
					 Son Hyong Gun, chairman of the Federation of south Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Unification, underscored the need to wage a brisk movement for peace against the U.S. and war and for solidarity with the people.
					
					 Kim Sung Min, chairman of the south Korean Youth League in Japan, vowed to fight as the vanguard in the movement for independence, democracy and reunification in 2016, too.
					
					 Kim Ji Yong, chairperson of the south Korean Democratic Women's Society, and Kang Je Su, chairman of the south Korean Students Consultative Council in Japan,  called for pooling efforts  to make this year  an epochal year for the movement for independence, democracy and reunification.

articles.title: DPRK Successful H-bomb Test Praised by Czech Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK Successful H-bomb Test Praised by Czech Organizations
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Czech Branch of the Korean Friendship Association sent a solidarity letter to the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries on January 6 hailing the DPRK's signal success in its first H-bomb test.
					 The letter said:
					
					 We send congratulations to the Korean people on the success in its first H-bomb test.
					
					 The Korean people have achieved great success and technological progress. This will help the DPRK more effectively cope with the aggressive moves of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 We wish the Korean people greater success in the future.
					
					 On the same day the Young Communist League of Czechoslovakia in a statement extended full support to the struggle of the Korean people to firmly defend the country from the nuclear threat and the danger of destructive war. 
					
					 One should not hesitate doing anything to smash the imperialist's aggressive moves and protect one's people and system, the statement added.

articles.title: UK Organizations Hail DPRK's Success in First H-bomb Test
articles.content:
UK Organizations Hail DPRK's Success in First H-bomb Test
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK issued a joint statement on Jan. 6 hailing the DPRK's success in its first H-bomb test.
					 The statement said:
					
					 We congratulate the DPRK on its signal success in its first H-bomb test.
					
					 This success means a victory of Juche idea, Songun idea and a heavy blow at the U.S. imperialists and their followers.
					
					 We fully support the statement of the DPRK government issued as regards the signal success made in its H-bomb test.

articles.title: Russian Organization Hails DPRK's H-bomb Test
articles.content:
Russian Organization Hails DPRK's H-bomb Test
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK on Wednesday made public a statement hailing the DPRK's successful first H-bomb test. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The DPRK has a legitimate right to carry out its own nuclear program. 
					
					 This is the independent right of a sovereign state. 
					
					 The DPRK's first H-bomb test is commanding absolute support from all of us. 
					
					 The world progressive people are interested in peace and security on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The peace and security on the Korean Peninsula are possible only when the DPRK has its own nuclear weapons as long as the U.S. and its followers persist in their moves for aggression. 
					
					 We hope that the DPRK will bolster up national defence capability to override the imperialists, meet all challenges of the disturbing forces and develop science and technology in order to further increase the nuclear deterrent.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Un's Assumption of KPA Supreme Commandership Observed in Germany
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Un's Assumption of KPA Supreme Commandership Observed in Germany
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany posted on its website a special write-up titled "Glory of Korea" illustrated with photos of Marshal Kim Jong Un on Dec. 30 last year, the fourth anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The website in its article sub-titled "Iron will" said:
					
					 Kim Jong Un visited the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the KPA on Jan. 1, 2012.
					
					 He expressed the iron will to invariably follow the road of the Songun revolution covered by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il all their lives and has made the tireless efforts to bolster the military muscle.
					
					 The website said in its article sub-titled "Glory of glory":
					
					 Looking up to Kim Jong Un, the army and people of the DPRK keenly feel the high glory and great fortune of having been blessed with the illustrious leaders down through generations.
					
					 The KPA which had grown stronger under the care of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il has become more powerful thanks to Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 It is the greatest honor of the Korean army and people to have him as the supreme commander.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Ugandan and Indian Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Ugandan and Indian Figures
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Figures of Uganda and India issued statements in support of the New Year Address made by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 The chairman of the Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement said on Jan. 1:
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address indicated the tasks and ways for bringing about a fresh turn in developing the economy and improving the people's living standard, calling for ushering in a golden age in building a thriving nation in this year when the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea is to be held.
					
					 He put up slogan "Let us frustrate the challenges by the anti-reunification forces within and without and usher in a new era of independent reunification!" and said that it is necessary to reject foreign intervention and resolve the issues of inter-Korean relations and national reunification independently in keeping with the aspirations and demands of the nation.
					
					 The Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement fully supports the historic New Year Address made by Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, in which the spirit of national independence is strongly felt.
					
					 Harish Singh Khan, member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), said on Jan. 3 that Kim Jong Un's New Year Address greatly encouraged not only the Korean people but the world revolutionary parties and the peace-loving progressives.  
					
					 He went on:
					
					 As Kim Jong Un clarified in his New Year Address, it is fundamental to realizing Korea's reunification to prevent the danger of war and safeguard peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The issues of the north-south relations and national reunification should be settled by the concerted efforts of the Koreans free from any foreign interference.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Beninese Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Beninese Political Party Leader
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's New Year Address is the correct design of building a thriving socialist nation. It is also the immortal programme for settling the issue of national reunification in the interests common to the nation beyond the differences of ideas and systems and realizing Korea's reunification by improving the north-south relations through dialogue and exchange.
					 Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, said this in a statement on Jan. 2.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities must not seek pointless confrontation of systems but make it clear that they intend to respect and implement with sincerity the three principles for national reunification, June 15 Joint Declaration and October 4 Declaration, which crystallize the general will of the nation.
					
					 I wish the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people brilliant victory in their struggle for smashing the challenges and disturbances of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad and building a thriving reunified nation, dignified and prosperous.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers' Anti-"Government" Struggle Introduced by Uruguayan Newspaper
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers' Anti-"Government" Struggle Introduced by Uruguayan Newspaper
 Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud carried a photo-accompanied report about the south Korean workers' anti-"government" struggle against the authorities' fascist crackdown and unpopular rule on Dec. 21 last year.
					 The newspaper said that 150 000 workers including members of the trade unions of 26 companies under the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions simultaneously went on general strikes in twelve areas on Dec. 16.
					
					 Noting that the south Korean chief executive let a tough response be given to the demonstration while terming it illegal, the newspaper said that Park Geun Hye's act showed once again she deserved to be called a daughter of a dictator.

articles.title: Mujeres de RPDC juran manifestar su impetu heroico
articles.content:
Mujeres de RPDC juran manifestar su impetu heroico
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 7 en la explanada del Monumento a la Fundacion del Partido el mitin de las funcionarias y miembros de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea para materializar las tareas indicadas en el mensaje del Ano Nuevo del Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					En el acto la presidenta del Comite Central de la UMDC, Kim Jong Sun presento un informe y otras mujeres hicieron uso de la palabra. 
					
					Las oradoras dijeron que al informarse del mensaje del Ano Nuevo del Mariscal Kim Jong Un y la primera prueba exitosa de bomba de hidrogeno de la Corea del Juche, todas las funcionarias e integrantes de la UMDC estan llenas de gran  orgullo nacional y fe en la victoria. 
					
					Expresaron la decision de cumplir con su responsabilidad en la ofensiva general de hoy por abrir la era dorada de la construccion de un Estado prospero poniendo de pleno manifiesto la ardiente fidelidad al partido y el extraordinario entusiasmo patriotico en acato al mensaje del Ano Nuevo. 
					
					Y manifestaron la voluntad de demostrar sin reservas en la lucha de hoy el impetu heroico de las mujeres coreanas de la epoca del Songun y contribuir a acoger el VII Congreso del Partido del Trabajo de Corea como conclave de victoria y gloria.

articles.title: Tienen lugar mitines multitudinarios provinciales
articles.content:
Tienen lugar mitines multitudinarios provinciales
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- Los mitines multitudinarios para materializar las tareas indicadas en el mensaje del Ano Nuevo del Mariscal Kim Jong Un tuvieron lugar los dias 6 y 7 en las provincias de Phyong-an del Sur y del Norte, de Hamgyong del Sur y el Norte, de Jagang, de Kangwon, de Ryanggang y en la ciudad de Rason. 
					A los conclaves asistieron los funcionarios, trabajadores y jovenes de los organismos del partido, el Poder y la economia, entidades de masas, fabricas, empresas, granjas y planteles docentes en respectivas localidades.
					
					En los actos hubo informes e intervenciones de decision de los delegados de los obreros, trabajadores agricolas, jovenes e intelectuales. 
					
					Los oradores senalaron que el Mensaje del Ano Nuevo del Mariscal llama al ejercito y pueblo coreano a la ofensiva general para registrar nuevo viraje en todos los dominios de la construccion de un Estado Prospero. 
					
					Llamaron a todos los militantes del partido y los trabajadores a registrar nuevo cambio en el desarrollo economico y en la mejora de la vida del pueblo concentrando todas las fuerzas en la construccion de la potencia economica bajo la consigna de "!Abramos una epoca de mayor esplendor para la construccion de un Estado poderoso y prospero en este ano en que se celebra el VII Congreso del Partido del Trabajo de Corea!".
					
					Apuntaron que todos los funcionarios y trabajadores deben hacerse creadores de meritos heroicos y milagros en la ofensiva general por el desarrollo economico y la mejora de la vida del pueblo en acato al mensaje del Ano Nuevo del Mariscal.
					
					Luego, hubo manifestaciones multitudinarias.

articles.title: Posesion de bomba de hidrogeno es derecho de autodefensa de RPDC, apunta Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Posesion de bomba de hidrogeno es derecho de autodefensa de RPDC, apunta Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- La prueba y posesion de bomba de hidrogeno son legitimos derechos de autodefensa de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y vienen una justa medida incensurable por nadie. 
					Adelanta el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual divulgado en su edicion de este jueves y continua:
					
					La prueba de bomba de hidrogeno de la RPDC no infringe los derechos internacionales. 
					
					La prueba y la posesion de bomba de hidrogeno de la RPDC son el derecho de autodefensa indispensable para defender la soberania del pais y el derecho a vivir de la nacion desde las cada dia mas crecientes amenaza y chantaje nucleares de las fuerzas hostiles encabezadas por EE.UU. y garantizar fidedignamente la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y la seguridad de la region. 
					
					Hasta la fecha, ni un pais brindo ayuda y simpatia a nuestro pais que vivia sufriendo la amenaza y chantaje nucleares de EE.UU. 
					
					En tal circunstancia rigurosa, nuestro ejercito y pueblo obtuvieron la verdad de que deben defender su propio destino con sus propias fuerzas. 
					
					Por esta razon, esta vez la RPDC llego a poseer la justa bomba H.
					
					Por mas que EE.UU. actue con imprudencia recurriendo a la politica hostil anti-RPDC, nuestro ejercito y pueblo materializaran mas cabalmente la linea de desarrollo paralelo del PTC y ejerceran en adelante tambien todos sus derechos de autodefensa.

articles.title: Hay que cesar de inmediato provocación militar, apunta Minju Joson
articles.content:
Hay que cesar de inmediato provocación militar, apunta Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- El día primero el jefe de la Junta de Jefes de Estado Mayor del ejército títere del Sur de Corea, recorriendo alrededores de la isla Paekryong, dijo que "el enemigo provoca algo en cualquier tiempo y lugar con método imprevisto" y ordenó a mantener el estado de firme disposición y enfrentarse cabalmente".
					 Por otra parte, el jefe del Estado Mayor de las fuerzas marítimas surcoreanas inculcó la conciencia conflictiva diciendo que "hay que tener la capacidad combativa como el filo del cuchillo y castigar de inmediato y rotundamente la provocación del enemigo".
					
					  Así señala el periódico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este jueves y prosigue:
					
					  Los disparates conflictivos de los belicistas surcoreanos pronunciados el primer día del Año Nuevo y los ejercicios de guerra contra la RPDC cometidos en todas partes del Sur de Corea, devienen los actos provocativos intencionales de los maníacos del enfrentamiento fratricida tendentes a agravar la situación y llevar a la catástrofe las relaciones Norte-Sur.
					
					  Prevenir el peligro de guerra en la Península Coreana y defender la paz y la seguridad son las condiciones principales para lograr la reunificación del país.
					
					  Por esta razón, nos esforzamos con paciencia e invariablemente por la paz y la estabilidad de la Península Coreana.
					
					  Pero, si los agresores y provocadores intentan pisotear al fin la aspiración de todos los coreanos hacia la reunificación pacífica con la guerra nuclear de la agresión a la RPDC, el ejército poderoso revolucionario del monte Paektu no lo perdonará ni en lo mínimo, sino responderá rotundamente con la sagrada guerra justa implacable y la gran batalla por la reunificación de la patria.
					
					  Los belicistas surcoreanos nunca deben juzgar erróneamente nuestros esfuerzos pacientes por la paz de la Península Coreana y la estabilidad de la región ni actuar con la imprudencia.
					
					  Si las autoridades surcoreanas desean de veras la mejora de las relaciones Norte-Sur y la reunificación por la paz, deben cesar de inmediato los peligrosos ejercicios de la guerra de agresión y la provocación militar que agrava la situación.
